createAllFixed

public boolean createAllFixed(int w,
                              int h)
create (of necessary) and return an offscreen image with the specified size. This image is intended to be used to draw background, rarely changing elements in the background.

Parameters:
w -
h -
Returns:
true if a new image was created

createOffScreen

public XImage createOffScreen(int w,
                              int h)
create (if necessary) and return an offscreen image with a specified size. This image is intended to be used for routine offscreen drawing before displaying on the canvas. If double buffering is in effect, the back buffer is returned.

Parameters:
w -
h -
Returns:
true if a new image was created

repaintCanvas

public void repaintCanvas(java.awt.Graphics g)

paintCanvas

public void paintCanvas(java.awt.Graphics gc,
                        boolean completePaint,
                        HitPoint pt)
this is the method that actually draws the window, which will can be superseded by the final window class. This default method creates an off screen bitmap and calls repaintCanvas() with the gc of the off screen bitmap, so if that is the desired behavior repaintCanvas can be overridden instead.

Parameters:
gc - a graphics object
completePaint - if true, do a complete refresh
pt - a HitPoint, representing the state of the mouse.
See Also:
HitPoint

repaint

public void repaint()
request a normal refresh of the window some background elements may not be repainted.
